name: Quick Boerewors in Tomato-Onion Gravy with Creamy Maize Meal
description: A family-friendly South African-style boerewors skillet simmered in tomato-onion gravy, served over creamy maize meal. Mild, simple, and ready in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Measure 1 cup maize meal and 4 cups water for the porridge.
Cut 700 g boerewors into 4–5 cm pieces.
Open 1 can tomato and onion mix.
cook_steps: Start maize meal: Bring 4 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt to a boil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
Whisk in 1 cup maize meal gradually to avoid lumps. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes, stirring every few minutes until thick and creamy. Stir in 1 tbsp butter; keep warm.
While maize cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add boerewors pieces and cook 5–6 minutes, turning to brown on all sides.
Drain excess fat if needed, then add tomato and onion mix to the skillet. Season with a pinch of salt and 1/4 tsp pepper.
Simmer 5–7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce slightly thickens and boerewors is cooked through.
Finish maize meal with another 1 tbsp butter if you like. Taste both components and adjust salt and pepper.
Serve a scoop of creamy maize meal in bowls, top with boerewors and spoon over tomato-onion gravy.
